candidates.title: Release 0.2.0
candidates.body: This enables the usage of the Todoist v2 REST API and unbreaks the tool.

candidates.title: Update cargo deps
candidates.body: Updating the cargo deps since we haven't had these for a while.

candidates.title: Add test for project and label lists
Add retries and backoffs
candidates.body:
- Add retries and backoffs to the gateway, should make it just a tad more
    resilient.
- Update cargo deps

candidates.title: Release 0.1.21
candidates.body:
This makes all interactive features that have been cooking for a while generally
available as a cargo install.

candidates.title: Upgrade to clap 4
candidates.body:
Goes through the whole process of updating to the newest clap, and went through
all the deprecation warnings too.

candidates.title: Release 0.1.20
candidates.body:
Adds the various new interactive methods:
- Continuous list operation
- Interactive task creation

candidates.title: Release 0.1.19
candidates.body: Include all the recent changes, most notably NO_COLOR mode.

candidates.title: Adjust coloring to disable it when requested
candidates.body:
Color will only show in terminals that support it and when the environment
variable NO_COLOR is not set. This will make the output properly pipable.

candidates.title: Add authentication integration test
candidates.body:
The first of many various integration tests, this checks if the authentication
is being correctly set up when doing `doist auth`.

candidates.title: Refactor interactive select
candidates.body:
I wanted to clean up all the various ways you can select interactively. Now
there should be only one way to do most of the interactive item selections
throughout the codebase. It's a bit ugly and involved, but this was the easiest
to avoid copy-pasta.

Additionally made subprojects to be shown in the project view, hah.

candidates.title: Publish 0.1.17
candidates.body:
Publish 0.1.17 that includes the new label list, creation and deletion and a
critical fix for task lists filtering out their parent tasks.

candidates.title: Publish 0.1.15
candidates.body: Makes list the default subcommand so `doist` already does something useful.

candidates.title: Fix undocumented colors crashing the app
candidates.body:
This allows colors to assume other numbers that were not entirely documented by
the Todoist documentation. I assume this is helpful for older projects, but will
make it also resilient for future updates. Added a small test to make sure this
case is fixed.

Fixes #24.

candidates.title: Add authentication test
candidates.body: Add an authentication test and update some Cargo dependencies.

candidates.title: Force dialoguer theme for active item so it doesn't break colors
candidates.body:
I noticed that when updating to the latest dialoguer with the active element
theme, it does break existing colors in the selected item. This way I get the
old behavior back while perhaps contemplating a patch for dialoguer to unbreak
this.

candidates.title: Extend README with new features and publish 0.1.11
candidates.body: Documented the new features and then bumped the cargo version for good measures.

candidates.title: Allow assigning projects with fuzzy search on task add
candidates.body: Now you can use `doist add "something" -P Project` to assign a task easily to a project

chosen_pr.title: Release 0.2.0
chosen_pr.body: This enables the usage of the Todoist v2 REST API and unbreaks the tool.

chosen_detail.title: Release 0.2.0
chosen_detail.body: This enables the usage of the Todoist v2 REST API and unbreaks the tool.

repo.name: doist
repo.description: doist is a command line app for interacting with the Todoist API
